page.title: 02POINTON-POPULATION & HOUSING
page.content: {POPULATION Over the last 200 years the population of Pointon has varied from 490 max. and at the present,it is around 450 and steadily declining. {HOUSING Most houses are owner-occupied, although there are some rented Council houses too. Most houses are built of brick, but some older ones are made of stone taken from the great Sempringham Priory after it fell into ruins. Roofs shows considerable variation. Many of the older houses have attractive orange-tan pantiles, others dull dark grey slates,while the newer ones have modern tiles. Houses vary too. There are imposing manors and farm houses, well-preserved Victorian, typical utilitarian terraced farm labourers' cottages and attractive modern bungalows.
